reviews.review_msg: Vlad is great! he is very knowledgable and so approachable with students. Its true that there's a lot of reading but his exams and pop quizzes were so easy. He even made a outline of what to study for exams which was very helpful. His exams were no more than 30 mins to complete it. One of the best prof in SFU for sure. Hopefully he gets full time.

In my opinion, Vlad teaches in a way that is more suitable for arts students because they are very comfortable with heavy load of readings and able to think in an abstract manner. If you are a science or business student, this class will require a lot of effort for you because you are required to think in an extremely different way.

Vlad is a nice guy but this is definitely a class where you will have to put in a lot of work, meaning you must read all the readings in details and have good memories because he will test you on the smallest details. You will only do well if your learning style matches his teaching style. I got a pretty decent grade but expect a LOT OF WORK.

Best professor I've had at SFU! Have no clue what the bottom comments are talking about with the low ratings... Grading was very fair and his tests were easy as long as you read the assigned material. Very approachable and always asked class for constructive criticism. He even let us shape our midterm/final. Would definitely take again!! :)

This class and prof are one of the best I've had at SFU. This is not the class for students trying to get a degree with minimal effort and who don't like coming to class. I passed with an A in the course just by showing up to class and actually paying attention. Fantastic class and a GPA booster in my opinion!

He is a nice guy but doesn't know what he is doing half the time. He prepares for his lectures but he just talks continuously with nothing you can follow along with. The readings has nothing to do with his lectures because he expects students to read and memorize all the readings without any issues. The workload for this course is extremely high.

This is definitely not the course you want to take if you need B-HUM credits. Go take another course. This course is extremely time consuming and Vlad expects you to know every single detail. If you don't write exactly what he wants and everything that he wants on your midterm/final, you will not succeed.

Vlad is one of the nicest professors I've had at SFU! But he is horrible at teaching and his lectures are so messy. It is so hard to follow along with him unless you have history or religious backgrounds! If you want to do well for this course, memorize every single readings because his pop quizzes are worth 20% of your final grade.

Vlad is a very nice professor and would help his students as much as he can. However, this was a first year course but was not taught with the expectations for first year students or students who does not have history background. He does NOT use lectures slides and it is so hard to understand his accent. If you want to lower ur GPA, go for it.

The readings assigned were very tough to understand and were very long for an intro course. He does not go over the readings during lecture. Instead, he talks about random things that is not part of course material which makes learning quite difficult. His exams were not based on the textbook like he promised! NEVER AGAIN.

Vlad is the best prof I've had at SFU. This class was my first history class, and the reason I will be taking more history classes. Excellent lecturer, understanding professor and very helpful. He should be a full time prof at SFU!

Eh... Could have been much better if it was not so requiring for a 100-level course. Can't imagine what her other classes are like. TAKE THIS CLASS ONLY IF YOU KNOW WHAT YOU'RE DOING! Really heavy, really professional.

Y'all are just bitter. Difficult course, but worth it! Mainly conceptual content, but changed my outlook on life and really improved me as a writer. Elise is a professional. Funny and self-aware, gives great lectures and encourages discussion. Don't take if you're not willing for your GPA to take a knock, but imo not really what's important in uni.

If you're considering taking this course for breadth, I would steer clear. Barely learned any actual historical facts- just vague concepts and theories. Emphasis on "thinking like a historian" but I'm not a history major so that's no use to me... Prof is super condescending and essay topic was vague.

Really great lectures that she relates to current events to help you understand and apply the learning. Stays on top of current events and stays relevant. Course material is really interesting and she's just great

I loved the content of the class but hated the prof. Her criteria for Primary Source Analysis was vague and always changing. She was not at all receptive to feedback, even when she asked for it, and she tried too hard to seem cool. Also, in the comments of my final she went on a rant about how hard it is to date a trans man or something?

Actually super surprised she doesn't have a great rating as she's a super interesting lecturer, pretty fair and understanding about assignments which is a nice change.  Learnt so much from this class and as a history major think it was very valuable to take as it adds so much to how i think about history.  More disorganized than usual profs tho.

Great prof but that is only if you put in effort.  You learn a lot about the topics and you learn a lot about life. Definitely not for people who only want to pass a class.   She has lots to offer.  Do not miss it if you want to aim higher and see the values in education.

Patronizing and condescending, if you don't agree with her you're wrong. Too much busy work for a 100 level course, does not respond to her emails to meet with students. Unhelpful! Apparently, I'm beginning to think like a historian 3 years into my degree, um ok.
Lacking of course related historical knowledge, for example not knowing not all concentration camps were extermination camps. Essay topic was broad and unclear for a 800 word essay.

Dr. Chenier is a great prof. She does expect a lot but she is also willing to help a lot. Her lectures are interesting and clear. Highly recommend her. Especially if you're a history major as she teaches you many skills needed in the field of study.
Prof C is so very accommodating.She knew that part of the subject matter was tough for me and she would send me the lecture notes ahead of time so I was prepared. I am so grateful for that!

Stop complaining professor Chenier is a really amazing professor. She does expect a lot but you have to put in the effort. None of her classes are easy grades. You have to work for them. Once you get to know her she is amazing. Best decision I made was to take her class.

Chenier is an excellent professor if you put in the time and are willing to learn new ways of developing yourself as a student. She is a clear narrator and was very concise in her ideas presented. She demands a lot from her students, this is not a course which you can easily glide through! I'm excited to take more courses with her.

Although this course is quite demanding Chenier makes it worth it! She is interesting, funny, and creates an open environment where even first years feel comfortable contributing. I would love to take more classes with her.

Elise is a lovely person, but she expects FAR too much from the people in her class.  For a 100 level course, I found the workload extremely large.  She thinks that students do not have anything else to do outside her class.  Sends out assignments on a Friday due Monday that are only for participation marks.

She was an amazing professor. She tries and makes her lectures fun and enjoyable for everyone. She loves to help students, cause she does not want to see someone fail. I will and would take another class with her.
